Class CPU 

java.lang.Object
   |
   +----CPU
public class CPU
extends Object
CPU. This puppy does everything!

CPU has the following registers.

    IR (4 bytes) Instruction Register IC (2 bytes) Instruction Counter C (1 byte) Compare (0 or 1) R (4 bytes) Register (for mischief)

Version:
9.10.1998, 12.06.1998
Author:
Ethan Georgi

CPU(Memory, Drisk, MOS, PCB)
Constructor.

BE(int)
BE: Branch if equal to a new location in the program
CR(int)
CR: Compare R to contents of virtual mem loc
execute()
Execute the instruction
fetch()
Fetch the next instruction from memory
getC()
Return the compare byte
getIC()
Return the instruction counter
getIOI()
What is the IOI flag set to?
getIR()
Gets the IR
getPI()
What is the PI flag set to?
getR()
Return the fabulous register of golden chicken nuggets
getSI()
What is the SI flag set to?
getTI()
What is the TI flag set to?
incIC()
Increment the instruction counter
LR(int)
LR: Load a virtual memory loc's contents into R
setIC(int)
Set an arbitrary value for the IC
setIOI(int)
Set the IOI flag.
setPCB(PCB)
assign a new PCB
setPI(int)
Set the PI flag to a value.
setSI(int)
Set the SI flag to a value.
setTI(int)
Add to the TI flag

  • 1 Time Slice up, switch to another process
  • 2 Time Limit up, kill it
  • 3 both of the above
    SR(int)
    SR: Store contents of R into virtual mem loc

    • CPU 
     public CPU(Memory m,
            Drisk d,
            MOS z,
            PCB p)
    Constructor. Monkies.

    Parameters:
    m - A reference to Memory
    d - A reference to Drisk
    z - A reference to the MOS
    k - A reference to the Terminate Q
    pcb - The Next PCB on ReadyQ

    getIR 
     public String getIR()
    Gets the IR

    Returns:
    the IR
    getIC 
     public int getIC()
    Return the instruction counter

    Returns:
    The IC
    getR 
     public String getR()
    Return the fabulous register of golden chicken nuggets

    Returns:
    R
    getC 
     public int getC()
    Return the compare byte

    Returns:
    C (1 = True, 2 = False
    fetch 
     public void fetch()
    Fetch the next instruction from memory

    incIC 
     public void incIC()
    Increment the instruction counter

    setIC 
     public void setIC(int v)
    Set an arbitrary value for the IC

    Parameters:
    v - The new value for the IC
    getSI 
     public int getSI()
    What is the SI flag set to?

    Returns:
    The value if the Supervisor Interrupt flag
    setSI 
     public void setSI(int v)
    Set the SI flag to a value.

    Parameters:
    v - The value to set SI to.
    getPI 
     public int getPI()
    What is the PI flag set to?

    Returns:
    The value if the Program Interrupt flag
    setPI 
     public void setPI(int v)
    Set the PI flag to a value.

    Parameters:
    v - The value to set PI to.
    getIOI 
     public int getIOI()
    What is the IOI flag set to?

    Returns:
    The value if the Input Output Interrupt flag
    setIOI 
     public void setIOI(int v)
    Set the IOI flag. Note that this ADDS the value you send to the flag. If you want to subtract from this flag, pass a negative number.

  • 1 Channel 1 is done
  • 2 Channel 2 is done
  • 3 Channels 1 & 2 are done
  • 4 Channel 3 is done
  • 5 Channels 1 & 3 are done
  • 6 Channels 2 & 3 are done

    Parameters:
    v - The value to add to IOI.
    • getTI 
     public int getTI()
    What is the TI flag set to?

    Returns:
    The value if the Timer Interrupt flag
    setTI 
     public void setTI(int v)
    Add to the TI flag

  • 1 Time Slice up, switch to another process
  • 2 Time Limit up, kill it
  • 3 both of the above

    Parameters:
    v - The value to add to the TI flag
    • execute 
     public void execute()
    Execute the instruction

    LR 
     public void LR(int loc)
    LR: Load a virtual memory loc's contents into R

    Parameters:
    loc - The location in virtual memory to fetch
    SR 
     public void SR(int loc)
    SR: Store contents of R into virtual mem loc

    Parameters:
    loc - The location in virtual memory to write to
    CR 
     public void CR(int loc)
    CR: Compare R to contents of virtual mem loc

    Parameters:
    loc - the location to compare to
    BE 
     public void BE(int loc)
    BE: Branch if equal to a new location in the program

    Parameters:
    loc - the location to branch to
    setPCB 
     public void setPCB(PCB p)
    assign a new PCB

    Parameters:
    p - The new PCB
